values: The worst people to be disappointed of: Family

I don't understand being awkward. There is no need for it. At all. I guess you would feel awkward - not answering my texts, not making the effort to communicate, and then having to see me at work most every day.  I just want to let you know that it's fine. I don't expect anything from  you but common courtesy. I don't expect much of you at all, you might at well not make things awkward. So please, relax. :-)

Quarter Life Crisis a month and a half too early.

Sigh.

I don't want this.
But I don't have the heart to tell you.

Your words are empty.
Though I want so badly to believe them.

There's that little something digging into my skin.
Whispering in my ear.

Though it may not be clear to you, it's clear to me.
For me, it's done. I have to tell you.
I just don't know how or when.

What to say, what to say. 

Those of you who keep in contact know what goes on it my daily life = Nothing Special! Haha. Life is fairly dencent, though we all have our little obstacles. I don't, however, feel like I am progressing. Every day is exactly the same. 

I'm patiently saving my pennies so I can move out by fall, which is good. I need to get out, badly! My family drives me insane, and I'm not even home that often! 

I oh so badly want to get back into art. It seems that everything else takes a priority, and I flat out forget to draw or take some pictures. Sigh. I hope to change all this soon.

I guess we are friends.
I think hell just froze over.

I feel like I should write something in here. But, what to write? Life has been complicated, as it often is. I think I make it harder than it needs to be. My procrastination and subtle fear of the unknown tend to get in the way. I swear, I'm a walking contradiction. I love taking chances, trying new things, but I can't seem to do such things in the appropriate areas. I feel like my friend circle has greatly fluctuated. I still have my bestie, and the miscellaneous people that I often talk to -- and of course, coworkers. But...I want to feel closer to more people. I want to take pride and comfort in those around me. I need to get out more. For the last couple months, I've been stuck in a bit of a rut. I stopped working out, I don't go out nearly as much, and I feel more and more like this mess that will never be anything but. I want to clean out my life; strip it down to the bare essentials, find out what is important to me, and build off of that. I want to nurture and progress in my goals and skills. I want to do more, see more, live more. I feel like I'm getting swept up in the dull and mundane. There's so much more to life than that shitty job you need for the money or the brain dead numb that comforts you as you stare at the TV, just to make the time pass. I need to make a list. Something I can look at everyday. Something to remind me of what I want out of life. I don't want my youth to pass me by.

I am so unhappy.
And tired. So tired.

Stop ignoring me. 
You're better than this. 
Or at least, I thought you were. 
Take one hour out of your 'busy' life and chat with me.
The more you act this way, the less I respect you.
From one mature adult to another,
Please stop playing these games. 
Man up.
Call.

Welp, 'ol 24 is creepin' round the corner.
I thought 23 was going to be such a successful year...
In retrospect, I suppose it has been, just not how I expected. 
I would say, more than anything, some major attitude changes were made. 
That counts for something, right? :-P

I can't wait to kick 24's ass.

As you may know, I am not a patient person. 
If I see something I want, I like to go for it. Right away. 
It's a blessing and a curse. It' my whole "leap before you look" deal. 

Internally, I'm in such a rush for someone to reciprocate feelings.
I try to play it off, even in my head.  
I just want to be shown interest.
I like to call it my Leo fault. It's the need for constant adoration and attention, which is probably why I often have more than one interest at a time. Mind you, when I say interest, it does not mean I'm sleeping with multiple people. It simply means that I'm a flirt and I like to see where each day is going to take me. 

Most of the time I like people and making new friends. I love making first impressions, for I think I'm fantastic at them. And secretly (or not so secretly) I'm looking for that spark, that chemistry with someone. 

It is said that good things come to those who wait. I just feel like I've been waiting for years; waiting for something to come through. I've been distracted in good and bad ways, yes, but I have not found the real thing yet. Well, I don't know if I should say that. I've had the real thing. I know what it's like to be in love.  But when looking back at the situation, I always wonder if it was all in my head. I was so blindly in love. He made it so easy. I just didn't know the truth behind it all. He hid so much from me. 

Ah but here I go rambling again. 
I guess all I can say is that I know what I want, I just have to find it. When it happens, it will happen. I just wish I weren't so damn impatient.

I sure do flip-flop constantly. 

C'est Danielle.

Although I am not fond of certain habits, I am growing more and more fond of this Aquarius and his personality. I am definitely less attached than I normally am to people I have interest in. I think it's somehow safer this way. It comes off as much more casual. Other distractions tend to veer my mind places anyhow. But there is something very familiar and wonderful when I am with him. It's being able to crack jokes, to make mistakes, for things to be a little messy. It's being able to incorporate that playfulness into what feels like the start of something good. Even if it were not to progress, I would appreciate and bask in the good feelings I am left with. All in all, it's refreshing. It's perfect for summer.

Lately I have been feeling completely alienated from those I have had a strong friendships with. There are two people in particular that I have hung out with for the first time in a couple months, only to find that they are significantly different from what I remember. I suppose these two people have had a couple of lifestyle alternating experiences, but I never thought it would change their behaviors around me. Very odd indeed. 

I have also noticed within myself that I am growing up. I am not jumping quite so blindly into every situation that presents itself; this is a good thing. It makes for less regret and internal struggling.  I swear, people are testing my limits though; pulling me from one extreme to another. I don't think I've ever trusted myself quite so much. 

Today I am choosing to keep this post public.
I wonder if you'll read it.
I wonder if you still check my page. 
I think you do.
I only wish you kept your promises.
I'm not going to lie. I'm scared.

This morning, I was just short of wanting to yell: "You mother-fucking piece of shit. I hope you die." I was feeling insecure, neglected, and slightly offended. But that has passed. Hooray! 

I was also reminded of my hypocrisy, so I had no real right to be upset in the first place. None the less, I ran with it, and I think I got it all out of my system. Thanks to the features of Facebook, I won't have to look at his daily posts. Mind you, they are as cryptic as mine most of the time, but I won't have to look at his profile page and be constantly reminded of his dickery. I like this. Before, there was no real reason to glance at it either way. I did or I didn't. I could, but I wouldn't. I would, but I didn't find anything. Now at least I have a reason to forget altogether. And it feels good. In this knowledge, I am no longer stuck in the purgatory of not knowing. God, it feels amazing. Refreshing. 

And as I've said in previous posts, I am free. Bullshit free. Drama free. Obligation free. Ahhh, yes. 

<center> * * * * * </center>

I was asked out by a very interesting fellow. He has had an amazing life, and I loved listening to his stories and about things he has accomplished and the way he grew up; it's all very impressive. The thing is, he has this major attraction to me (he tells me so), and I am left feeling unsure. I just don't know if I'm attracted to him. He's not too much older than I, but I don't think I'm mature enough for him. I appreciate his maturity, but I think ultimately, I have a lot more growing up to do before I can be with someone like him. Hell, I might never be that mature. Perhaps our ideas of fun are just considerably different. Don't get me wrong - it was a great date! A jaunt around Bodega Bay, a very nice dinner, and taffy and wine to top it all off, but my mind and my body were slightly uncomfortable. At the end of the day, I ended up being tense and awkward, which is very unlike me. I refused a kiss, and glanced awkwardly around. I don't want it to be an omen, but perhaps my senses are telling me something. I tend to ignore my instincts and do as I please anyway. But look at where it's gotten me: not much of anywhere. Perhaps now that area number one (see first paragraphs) is clear, I'll be more in the moment and laid back. I think it's about time I started listening to my intuitions. I'm just going to play it by ear.

Just let it go.

He was just a pretty face. 

Nothing more. 

You know this. 

Don't let it get to you.

It's not worth it.

You haven't done anything wrong. 

It's not you. It's him.

I'm over it, I'm just still hurt. 

I hate how other people can be so callous. Mean. Spiteful. Even the indifference shows how little you care.

I feel so bad for you. I don't mean this in an angry way; I mean this in an honest way. You're going to end up alone if you don't grow up. No one is there to do things solely for you. No one hangs on every word you utter. Life is what you make of it, and you have the worse attitude towards it I have ever witnessed. I am just so relieved that I don't have to deal with your high school drama and your mind games. You are trapped there. You will never take advantage of me again. 

I may not know exactly what I want to do with my life, but I am always open to new experiences. I never expect anything but common sense, honesty, and common courtesy from others. I would never treat anyone the way you end up treating the people that know the real you. Simply put, I am a better person. 

To quote a popular pop-star: "I would never wish bad things for you, but I don't wish you well." 

You put yourself there. Get yourself out.

Where did my happy streak go? 

COME BACK! I miss you. :-(

Seeing as how the next couple of weekends are filled with events, I'm really hoping it will come back. All I wanna do is sit around and eat ice-cream all day, even though by my third bite I can't taste the flavor anymore and my teeth hurt.

I'm lonely. 
I'm mopey. 
I'm not tired, but I feel like sleeping.
Everything feels very unattainable today. 
I don't feel defeated, but my mood seems to be reflecting the weather today. 
I want to feel needed.

Most of all, I hate having all this time to think about it.
I can't be left alone in this mood. 
I'm sure swim class will cheer me up. Almost always does.

Hello World!

I'm in decent spirits today. 
The weather here in Sonoma has been perfect. Ugh. I just wish I didn't have to sit indoors for 9 hours... A hike sounded like so much fun!

I seem to keep putting myself in interesting social situation that potentially could get me in lots of trouble. I swear, I'm not socially masochistic. Ha! But I suppose one must test the boundaries to know where one stops being comfortable. I need to expand my friend base. I'd like to have more close friends. More people I can share things with. Adventure with; play with. 

I want to travel. I want to visit Shannon in Australia. That sounds like a wonderful time. If only I had the funding, right? 

I hope this content feeling lasts a little while. :-)

I don't think I've ever felt like so much, yet so little has happened in this amount of time. 

What a month.

...buh?

I must say, the day had started off rather well. In the last few hours I have over thought, analyzed, and dissected far too many social situations and my relationships with other people. It is completely frustrating. Everything feels like a lie. A dirty, hidden lie. And here I was attempting to be sincere. 

Betrayed. 
Ashamed to have these kinds of people around me.
Where are the genuine souls?
The lighthearted. 
The motivated. 
The good.

I can only rely on myself. A lonely, but true statement. 
I just wish I had some company.

Last week was Finals week and therefore was the of my Body Conditioning class. While I didn't noticeably lose buckets of weight, I did gain a bit of strength. Here are my stats from the beginning of class to the end :

Running 12 minutes:
Before: 4 laps
After: 5 laps

Crunches for 1.5 minutes:
Before: 40
After: 75

Push-ups for 1.5 minutes (real ones on my toes):
Before: 7
After: 27

Arm Dips for 1.5 minutes:
Before: 10
After: 30

Yay! The thing about running though, is that I could have gone 5 more laps by the end. I was pacing myself. But overall, a vast improvement. Just gotta start eating better I guess...even though I never have eaten badly (my mom being so into organic, and always having fruits and veggies around).

Oh. HI LIVEJOURNAL. What's up?

Lots has changed since September 27th. 
No drama llama though, which is nice. It's been mellow. Mellow and lovely. Just letting things be a lot more than I'm used to. Not meddling as much, and not letting people spoil my days.

How are you people who still use this thing? :-)

Crush Ada Limon Maybe my limbs are made mostly for decoration, like the way I feel about persimmons. You can't really eat them. Or you wouldn't want to. If you grab the soft skin with your fist it somehow feels funny, like you've been here before and uncomfortable, too, like you'd rather squish it between your teeth impatiently, before splitting the soft parts back up to linger on the tongue like burnt sugar or guilt. For starters, it was all an accident, you cut the right branch and a sort of light woke up underneath, and the inedible fruit grew dark and needy. Think crucial hanging. Think crayon orange. There is one low, leaning heart-shaped globe left and dearest, can you tell, I am trying to love you less.

Just had a bit of a *BING!* moment. Ya know?
Like, WHAT was I worried about? 

I don't even know anymore.
I feel silly. :-)

Time to get to work. 
No more messing around.

I would not consider myself a flighty person. I like commitment. 
I admire and appreciate it. I actually prefer it. 
So why, from the two men that have seriously told me they want a future (or just something long term) with me, have I totally freaked out about? I mean, I can say for the first that I was always hesitant. For roughly 4 years or so, this gentlemen was telling me he was going to marry me and we were going to make babies, etc, etc. I always played it off in my mind and smiled politely. Then sometime around February, I said "fuck it." I let myself fall. I went against my intuition and let myself get emotionally involved only to be let down a few months later. I was amazed that after literally YEARS it was all over in a matter of months. I hate to say it, but I felt lied to and betrayed. Most of all I was mad at myself for throwing caution into the wind and for not listening to what I knew to be true. 

The other gentleman is obviously recent. There hasn't been full out proposals and commitments, but there has been mention. I always take it as a joke. I think I joke a lot about things that make me uncomfortable. Just a automatic defense I suppose. I think the idea is sweet. The romantic girly girl in the back of my mind dreams and fantasizes of what it would be like. But I think that's just it, fiction. The part of me that longs for it is the part that is only in it for the new experience. For the thrill, the excitement, not the solid fact of being with someone for possibly the rest of my life. I get so suspicious. Based especially on the number of people I know this boy has been with, who is to say that he hasn't said these things to every single person before me? When I asked why me, why now, and why the interest, among the various responses, I got one that consisted of this being the right time and place. That he hadn't been ready for a while. While I admire this, it also makes me wonder. Seeing as how I'm the first person he is committing to seriously in a while, am I a security blanket? And so fast! It's been literally a month!! Am I here just to be here? Am I what I am simply because I am willing and available? There's actually quite a bit more to this situation I'm not going to write now though. Perhaps at a later date when I'm feeling more honest and ballsie. 

Am I forever going to be plagued with doubt? Every single time I get into a relationship, I bitch, moan, complain....find SOMETHING wrong! Don't get me wrong, it's never all bad. I have fond memories of almost all my partnerships. I never say anything because I don't want to cause unnecessary fighting. I don't want to be THAT person, you know? 

I keep going back and forth in my mind. I'm scared. Half of me feels like looking for that certain someone. That person that I'm going to spend the rest of my life with. The person I can raise kids with, grow old with, adventure with. The other half of me says to wait, that I have time. And I know I do. I'm not in any real rush. There's so much I want to accomplish before I alter my life forever and make babies! But then I hear horror stories. Of bodies failing, complications as the years go on. There's so much that could go wrong. I guess the best bet is to find a healthy medium. One life, one chance. I'm sure I'll know when I feel ready. 

But really, I gotta start listening to my intuitions. They're usually right.

I've felt so productive the last few days. I forgot how good it feels to be busy without the stress. Feels good. 

I just feel...really laid back. Whatever happens, happens.

I hate being constantly reminded that I have been overlooked by multiple people. At first I don't even realize it, but then this eerie little feeling creeps up and goes: "They really don't give a shit." 

It makes me wonder if their feelings were ever genuine. Even though they might currently just be distracted, I refuse to be ignored and flat out left without an explanation. What makes you think you can do that? I hope you don't think you will ever have a chance back in my life the way you used to. But then of course, I look at the other side and say: "You have lost me, but that means I have lost you as well." Fucking mutualism. 

I just want to matter. I want to mean something to somebody. I like going out on limbs for people I care about. I love being generous, doing something nice for somebody close. It may sound selfish, but I would love a little in return once in a while. Which brings me back to my bitter and jaded tendencies: "I can rely on no one but myself."

I can't even remember the last time I had a real hug. 
A real, meaningful hug. To be able to just let go. Relief. Reassurance. 

I need a hug.

For the most part, things are looking up.

Yay!! :-D

No really, I'm okay. And it feels weird to be able to say that. It's like it never really mattered. ...Like I only made it matter for the brief glimpse of drama and gossip... Weird indeed. My motivation lies in the strangest places these days. In the last couple of weeks I have actually been excited about studying for my Astronomy tests. I feel THAT much more accomplished. Both my horoscopes via The SF Chronicle and The Press Democrat are fitting today. And, ya know, even if you don't agree with the whole Astrology thing, you can always look at it as a little insight, or advice. SF CHRON: Leo - Mars and Venus do the bill and coo thing in your friendship house. He wants action, she wants romance. Add powerful Jupiter to the equation and anything is possible. You could feel overwhelmed. PRESS: Leo - Many of you can improve your closest partnerships so much this year, you'll achieve a closeness and warmth and shared joy you thought was not possible. This is heady stuff! Learn how to be the best friend or partner that you can be. Can you say Theme? Bring it on!!!

For those of you that don't already know: M1 Baby! Motor Time!! Hee hee. I will have the last laugh. You will regret the mistakes you have made. In the last few days I have realized that some people are better friends than I expected. Supporting me when I needed it and such. Thank you guys. <3

The weather is a perfect reflection of how I feel. Just kinda overcast. I find it refreshing. I like the cool weather. It's a change. And as we all know: Danielle is addicted to change! It's going to be a good day. 

So, right after work yesterday I acquired some disappointing news that at that instant made me quite dramatic and angsty. Luckily I got to hang out with Lauren, Connor, and Nick which totally perked up my night. I also got to see Max for a few minutes - drunk I'm sure - but Max time none the less. The fireworks were awesome as always. The ride home through all the traffic was quite enjoyable! We blasted 80's music that we could sing along to with all the windows rolled down. <3

Anyway, my eye has been sporadically twitching the last two days. Mom says it's the lack of sleep. Others tell me I'm stressed. Stressed about what? And I get plenty of sleep! Who knows...

BRUNCH TIME! Nom nom nom nom.

I really want to stop dreaming about you. (S)
I think the only reason I do is because you are what my mind currently identifies with. You are simply embodying what I desire. It does not have anything to do with you in actuality. 

On that note. I would love to be in a relationship. 
Unfortunately, I am not a patient person. 
I long for intimate companionship.
Someone I can go and do things with as well as smother in PDA. 
I 1000% know that this can happen. 
I just wonder why it hasn't.
Why and how am I hindering this?

Keep your promises, Oranges.

Anywho.
Happy Fourth, everyone! :-)

Why do I keep holding back?

What do I have to lose?

What am I afraid of doing?

I am what I am. 
If only I could show it. 

I think I just need someone to say: 
I want you to be here.
I want to have fun with YOU. 
Someone to tell me I'm not just there to be there. Not to be another body; to actually be there because I am fun and an enjoyable human being. 

I often find when I interject, I get no response. It's like, why am I even here? My speech, my input, will have absolutely no effect, so what is the point?

I know I can be myself. 
I just have to find the right people to be around.

Sooo. Hank is missing. Sometime last night he got out of the house, and the family and I spent a good deal of time running around the neighborhood attempting to find him. No good. Hank is the family dog BTW. Hopefully today someone will call him in. See? This is why I like cats. They always come back unless they die. 

Anyway! Moving on from that morbid note: Come river rafting with me, you pansies. July 2nd, American River. IT WILL BE FUN. You know you want to. Call me aboot it!

My arms are weirdly tan. 

Birthday soonish. 
Tahoe sooner.

I hope I make it through Astronomy.

Golden.

Feeling good today. Got some sun, read in the shade, and remembered what this summer is about. Feeling a much needed sense of well-being and confidence. Warm fuzzies all around!

Tomorrow I pick up my already spent paycheck and go to the DMV for my motorcycle license! YAY!!

I think I am simply going insane. 

So many things have been irritating me lately. 
I seriously want to break down and cry, but nothing that's wrong is worth crying over, it's just frustrating and taxing upon my brain. 
I'm sure my mood is mostly influenced and magnified by lack of sleep, but it would be great if my little bugs in life were plowed by a windshield of change and progress.

I need my ego to be stroked a little bit, get my flirt on. 
I want to kiss. 
I want a partner in crime. 
I want to disgust everyone with massive amounts of PDA.

And I want to stop dreaming of unattainable things.

Please, show some interest.
<font size="1">Please please please please please please please please please please please!</font>

I need to stop being quite so passive. Really. 
Determined to get the things that I want out of summer. Well, life in general too. Perhaps this is why nothing has happened romantically for me in the last 8 months. I need to be more assertive. What do I want? Cause I am going to get it.

Hopefully it's not the end. 

Hopefully.

In other news, I am experiencing my first hangover. Whoo! Let me tell you: It is terrible. Simply should not have had that last drink. I thought I could make the drunk go away by eating a couple doughnuts and downing a bottle of water, but nooo! My body decided to have none of it. Coughed it all up on the side of the road after talking to Kent for awhile. Thank god he was awake. Mind you this is like 4am. Don't remember everything we said to each other, but he was very sweet after initially making fun of me. :-P

Don't get me wrong, the night was swell before that car ride home. Went to the free showing of Tosca broadcasted at the AT&T Ballpark with some lovely people. Proceeded to a bar and had a good few convos. Just...that damn last drink. C'est la vie!

I either fucked up, or made things a lot more interesting.

C'est la vie.

I'm not having a recurring dream, but I am definitely dreaming about some of the same people almost every night. This is weird for me. I never even considered myself that dream oriented. And I can't find my dream book. Lame. I would love to look up what some of these things mean. 

So, this dream, I was walking around a park with a little dog. It was a big park, and all the grass and leaves on the trees were green. The walk goes on and night was approaching, so I start trying to retrace my steps. I come to a 4-way cross road. I look in all directions, and each direction looks the same. I keep looking at each direction, hoping one will change even slightly. I think one does, so I start walking that way. I pass a few street lights and curved curbs surrounded by bushes and residential like sidewalks. I don't really remember passing people, but I may have, because at some point, I get the feeling that I am being followed. I go back into the park area which has become more and more wilderness like until I come to a small shed. For some reason, I recognize this shed and go inside, locking the door behind me, as I can see through the side panels that a man had been following me, and tries to come into the shed. The next few thoughts are a little blurry, but I remember the man outside being arrested and taken away. So, now I'm in this shed. It looks like a kind of kid's cabin. It has the Harry Potter thing going on (it looks really small from the outside, but is actually large on the inside). It has a very warm feel on the inside. The walls are painted a warm maroon color, and there are bunk beds made of pine. Miscellaneous strings of lights, pictures, and hangings are all over, giving the place a very homey feel. Somehow various people from the group spawn, and are conversing and laying in the bunk beds. Now it gets a little confusing. I remember seeing and talking with a potential love interest (perhaps more), and suddenly parts of one of the walls come down. The shed collapses, but we are all left within an even bigger cabin/house which apparently belonged to a man we were renting the shed from. The house we are in also has a warm house feel, but larger, and with deep sea green foam walls and lots of books. We all see the man, apologize, and start to reconstruct the shed within the house again. From there on, I can't remember much else. But I mean, really, what kind of dream is that? Weird. 

The other thing - when I dream of this potential love interest (and I have been recently dreaming of him almost every night. It makes me feel like a dream stalker!), it seems in almost every dream, something goes wrong. I can't decide if something is wrong, and I am being saved or because I am in the company of this person, I am doomed - meaning that it would never work between us. Who knows.

I had the weirdest dream. 

It consisted of one of the dishwashers from work inserting a needle into my wrist to test for Pneumonia. I was all freaked out because I was thinking "Uh, does she know what she's doing?" Anyway...
Then it panned to being at some sort of sporting event, and seeing a certain gentleman that has been buggin' me to hang out recently. I don't really remember there being a specific plot to this dream, but it was so bizarre. And when I woke up, the arm that had been stuck with a needle was completely asleep.

I guess the last few days in general I have been having very vivid and random dreams. The night before I dreamed about seeing all these beautiful landscapes from very swanky apartment windows, and being lost within very nice college dorms to then running around a large commercial shopping mall. If this is my mind trying to work things out, it's sure going about it in an odd way. 

...

I miss being in love. I miss the feeling of having someone whose every hug, touch, and kiss are special. That they actually mean something. That they are not just for the sake of doing them. That they have genuine emotion and purpose behind them. I am glad, however, that I don't feel lost or hopeless as I usually do. I just feel kinda blank about it. I do wish I had some prospects. 

C'est la vie.

Where is the point where dating turns into a relationship? Is it defined by sex? Or is it defined by seeing that person more than once or twice a week? Cause none of these things has happened yet. What is the determining factor? 

I've never even had to think about it in the past. It was always established. It just feels really vague. I simply say that we are dating. Although, he has said in the past that he needs to know that the person he is dating is exclusive. Mind you he didn't specifically say ME. But how serious is serious? 

The other side, is he is easily scared off. He misinterpreted something I had said during a conversation and apparently thought I was implying long term commitment. I said no such thing, but he was weirded out none the less. It's hard to gage. 

I am certainly not a dependent person, I have plenty of things to do to entertain me throughout my days. But, if I don't see or talk to someone that I am interested in within a few days, I lose interest. And don't get me wrong, I'm all for texting and such, but when it's no more than a few friendly exchanges, I find myself getting bored and losing interest. Sad? I don't need someone to be obsessed with me either, I just want to know that special someone is at least thinking about me. Maybe he just needs to let his guard down?

The other thing - I don't know how much you Petalumians would like him. I can't see him really fitting into the whole geek-squad-death-skating-crazy-drunken crowd. Not sure I like that either. 

So I guess for both our sakes, and my sanity, we are dating. Nothing more. 

Besides, I want to have a wild and crazy summer. Fo serious.

I had a dream. Apples wasn't in it. Oranges wasn't in it. Someone I'm going to call Strawberries was in it. (I know the fruit names are lame, but I like being cryptic, okay?) Is my mind trying to tell me a better option? The funny thing was that I had just been out with Oranges, too. I had dismissed Strawberries almost completely. I never feel like I can be myself around them. Not that I completely rely on my dreams for much of anything - I have had some weird ones. But I like to think that sometimes your dreams are just a way of your mind working things out for the better.

And I hate not knowing where Oranges and I stand. 
SUPWITDAT? 

Why are the Pears so goddamn hard to find?

This summer I plan on being too busy with fun adventures and trips to even have time to care about little details I find myself focusing on these days. Swimming, biking, hiking, kyaking, rollerblading, going out at night, drawing, painting, water skiing, walking, dancing, and Tahoe. Bliss now. Everything else later. 

Going to live carefree - my heart on my sleeve. Not going to let all the little things get to me. I will be too busy for them to even matter. 

Only three more weeks.

The weather today has made me rediculously happy. I've been whistling to myself the entire day. Mostly "Singin' in the Rain." Hee hee. 

Yeah, no more with the livid thing. Resolved and forgotten, which I didn't even think was possible. 

The next couple of weeks will be interesting. The business manager is on vacation, so that means I get to take over her job...without the salary. Whoo! But, at least I will have some decent hours for the next couple weeks and did I mention? I got a raise! It's just the annual thing, but hey, every little thing counts. 

I am wondering if I should take any summer classes. It really won't make a difference for next semester, except the slight raise in GPA. We shall see. 

Man, I am so over Apples. Well, I mean, I'm not, but I was investing way too much emotion into that. I'm glad I realized it's not anything to fret about. I do, however, like Oranges. Which is good and bad. Either way, it'll be an experience. I do have little tidbits of nostalgia floating around too. 

I hope everyone is out enjoying their day. :-)

I'm livid.

It's almost as if there is too much to write.
I swear, I'm about to yell at the TV. 
Every little thing is tweaking my nerves.
That, and Diane Keaton is annoying. 

Lately I just get the feeling that supposed friends are not telling me the whole story. 

Details later.

So, my friend Juli posted this via Facebook, but I liked it and thought I would share. Please feel free to write your own thoughts. So is it more virtuous to sell your body or your mind? Our culture would have us sell both. Any job that you perform (no matter how mundane, or physically in exerting) requires that you think and act for your employer and your employer pays you for your services. there are varying scales of actions and pay for example: a construction worker sells his body- his job is almost entirely physical ; whereas a computer programmer sells his mind and ability to his employer. which one of these extremes is assigned the higher monetary value? the computer programmer. in a society that supposedly rewards virtue monetarily (we are "capitalist") the "winner" in the scenario is that man who sells his brain, not the man who sells his body. so if money is the test of virtue and selling one's brain fetches a higher price than one's body, then in our society it is more virtuous to sell your mind then your body. We also know this because of the negative connotation that sometimes comes with more physical jobs- for instance being a prostitute or a coal miner is not seen by society as honorable or respectable; whereas being an intellectual, a "rocket-scientist" shall we say is looked upon with humble respect. Let us momentarily pause on that line of reasoning to clear something else up. Where do you believe your "being" or "essence" exists? Do you believe that your limbs control your thoughts and actions, that your toe falls in love with the girl in your pe class? Or do you believe that your brain judges the world that it sees and interprets and that "YOU" exist in your head- you live in a nest of neurons? That you think and feel with the organ of your body that is capable of processing information? You believe that "YOU" reside in your brain, don't you? So back to the original argument, with an added twist. Now based on the fact that "YOU" exist in your brain, do you still find it more virtuous to sell your brain than your body? Are you still willing to accept minimum wage as an acceptable price when you sell not only your ability to reason, but in fact "YOURSELF" on the open market? When one sells his body what is he really selling? Not the concept of "HIMSELF" just the container. He is selling muscle and fiber, not thinking and emotion. When a whore rents her body, does the john ever touch her concept of "SELF?" NO! he touches her body. (though psychologically speaking she may bring him into her concept of self). Are you not selling more of yourself when your brain is involved than when it is merely physical labor? So back to the original question: which is more virtuous; selling you mind or body? When you sell your brain, the work comes from "YOU" you have to think about it, feel it and create it. The work becomes a part of "YOU," and whatever your salary is, is the price that you have accepted for selling yourself. Is it worth it? When you sell your body, it is merely a physical investment. You remove rocks from a quarry- you build a house- whatever it is that you do. You are still left your mind. You perform a physical task and then you go home. You are not invested in that task beyond what you can lift. So which is better, selling the essence of yourself; or selling the vessel that carries that ego? Then, this was my response: I liked this line: "Do you believe that your limbs control your thoughts and actions, that your toe falls in love with the girl in your pe class?" My toes are total players. They fall in love with boys all the time, this is why I must wear more socks. My body and my mind are the greatest instruments that I will ever own. Those, and maybe my camera. But it makes me think, with your argument of selling either, don't we kind of do both outside of our job? Our minds we often sell to unworthy people. They don't gain anything monetary, but they do get some of our memories. Sometimes unknowlingly we let people plague our heads and thoughts. Where is the buffer? Our bodies we often sell to society. We dress a certain way, more or less conforming to fashion over function. We also sell our bodies to food companies. There are so many foods we won't ever need, but in the search for nourishment, we turn to taste palet pleasers. It's like: Please fill me up! I'm sure I could have written more, but you get the jist. Enjoy!
